name: wince
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to show pain or embarrassment suddenly and for a short time in the face, often moving the head back at the same time: Did I hurt you? I thought I saw you wince. It makes me wince even thinking about eye operations. Compare
quail verb literary
flinch
More examplesFewer examplesThe mere memory of the injury made him wince.He winced in the headlights' glare.I didn't want to wince every time I saw a picture of myself.

More examplesFewer examplesWhen his girlfriend started to vomit, he tried to hide a wince.I'm getting better at ignoring the winces from the old people as my kids play. Paul sustained near-crippling injuries with barely a wince.
